summary: Penguins are flightless birds that live mostly in the Southern Hemisphere. They have black and white feathers and flippers to swim in the ocean. Penguins eat fish, squid, and krill. The emperor penguin is the largest, standing over 3 feet tall and weighing about 77 pounds. The smallest is the little blue penguin, around 12 inches tall and weighing about 2.6 to 2.9 pounds. Ancient penguins were even bigger, as tall and heavy as humans.
title: Penguin
